reviews.text: Fantastic property! It's exceptionally clean, and luxe. Room sizes are great and the bathrooms are heavenly. Great restaurants below the hotel, and the location is extremely convenient! Would definitely return!
reviews.title: Beautifully restored

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just completed two stays within a short period at the Station Hotel and we can not wait for the opportunity to return. The standard of service is outstanding and the quality of the fittings and furnishings gives one the feeling of being on one of the great transatlantic liners of the last century. The attentiveness of every member of staff was exceptional even down to the bell-boy who bravely took our two exceedingly heavy suitcases all the way to the platform of the Narita Express in the station below - through rush-hour crowds. A wonderful hotel, one of the greats.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here several years ago before the recent major renovation. It had the feel of a quaint luxury hotel from days past with its dark hardwood furnishings and old fashioned steam radiator heating. I was looking forward to staying again after the renovation.
reviews.title: Grand and luxurious hotel

reviews.text: I was not disappointed at all. The hotel exterior, which is part of Tokyo Station, was restored to its original appearance. The interior was completely remodeled to current luxury standards with extensive use of marble and fine hardwood.
reviews.title: Nice and convenient

reviews.text: The rooms are beautiful and have all the amenities expected at luxury hotels anywhere, but also have those Japanese touches such as toilets with heated seats and lids that raise automatically when you approach.
reviews.title: Comfortable with a touch of European flair
Amazing service, very classy, comfortable stay
reviews.text: I stayed here because of its unbeatable location but it is so much more than a convenient hotel to stay in. From the moment my husband and I stepped off the Narita Express train, two of the hotel's staff members were waiting for us outside of the train car (a free service which they provide if you request it). They took our luggage right away and began to guide us through the labyrinth that is the massive Tokyo Station. The staff's English was very good and they were friendly and helpful. Once we checked in without a hitch one of the nice ladies who met us at the station escorted us up to our room and gave us a complete tour of the room's amenities as well as directions to best navigate our way in, out, and around the hotel. Honestly, service from a hotel doesn't get better than this.

reviews.title: Luxurious & stately
reviews.text: The room itself is gorgeous. The space is generally what you would expect in Tokyo, a bit small but not at all cramped or uncomfortable. The room (as well as the halls, lobby, Atrium, etc.) is tastefully decorated. Everything from the marble floors, wainscoting, molding, color scheme, artwork, was thoughtfully arranged. The style is kept true to the era of the original hotel but remodeled with all the comforts of modern living. They did an impeccable job of combining style and function and packing it all into a small hotel room. The queen size bed was comfortable, pillows were nice and the space was very clean. The bathroom is similarly pleasing to the eye and very functional.

We had breakfast buffet at the Atrium (pricey, $32 per person). The atmosphere of the Atrium is simply beautiful. The food is tasty and the spread is quite respectable for both the western and Japanese cuisine selections. While quite expensive for breakfast, I recommend trying it if you have some spare coin and time. It's a very enjoyable meal and a lovely, calm, satisfying way to begin a day in Tokyo. You must reserve the buffet in advance or reserve it when you check in. The Atrium buffet is for staying guests only.
reviews.title: can't beat location, nicely done

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellently appointed & located. Top service & attention to detail. You wouldn't know the train station is in the same building as you can't hear it. Spa treatment excellent. A wonderful way to be introduced to Japan! Sushi restaurant superb!
reviews.title: Excellent Location inTokyo
Smart and efficient hotel in great location
reviews.text: the euro appearance of the hotel really make the hotel feel fancy. it's nicer than a nice business hotel (marble floors in guestroom, solid furnishings, fancier toiletries) but not quite same as the top luxury hotels. booked a basic room which was kind of small-ish but sufficient, and i think would be kind of tight squeeze for a couple for more than a couple nights. my room had a view directly into the shinkansen tracks, like a little gnome nesting in the train track cracks. the window soundproofing was pretty good and it helps that the trains stop running shortly after midnight so the noise isn't bothersome while sleeping. since the building is shaped like a train station, the hallways are very long, like a train platform. "dome" rooms face the interior of the train station and i don't believe get natural daylight. of course service and staff are very friendly and helpful as expected in japan. love all the old photos of tokyo station in the hallways. fitness and spa have fee for regular guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is elegant and sumptuous and worth the expense for a few days as it's so convenient. Easily accessible from the train station (despite what others have said you do not need to go outside if you take the right exit from the station). The room was modest in size but perfectly appointed and had a fabulous bathroom. Major sites in the city are within easy reach and great shopping and dining nearby.
reviews.title: Grand elegance

reviews.text: This historical old pile of brick that spans a full city block has been very well renovated with excellent accommodations.
reviews.title: A Great Pile Reborn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are so many good things about this place but they can easily be overshadowed by the flaws. Arriving in pouring rain one fends for one's self. There does not seem to be any bellmen to assist arriving guests. The small lobby is crowded most of the time. The corridors defy imagination as they extend for hundreds of meters and a long brisk walk only brings one into the next and yet the next. Rooms with 00 in them require the ultimate trek.
reviews.title: Elegant Hotel in Ideal Location with Top-notch Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying here can only be described as a bizarre experience as one is at once awed by great bathrooms and vexed by no evening service, poor breakfast buffet and very spotty internet.
reviews.title: Grand experience - like time travel with all modern conveniences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is not unusual to see hoards of visitors gawking at the historical portraits on the walls of the long corridors or even wedding pictures being taken in the hallways.
reviews.title: A grand hotel rediscovered!

reviews.text: We booked in at the Tokyo Station Hotel for our last two nights in Japan and we really enjoyed it. The two reasons we stayed here were that we had a relatively early flight when we came back to the UK and wanted to be conveniently located for the Narita Express and that we wanted to end on a high with a great hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful and conveniently located hotel

reviews.text: The hotel itself is stunning and very comfortable. There are a few reasons though that I haven't awarded them an excellent rating. Firstly, the layout is not great and we were in a room that was a very long walk from the elevators and reception. Secondly, the atmosphere is very elegant but almost too elegant. The lobby bar was dead by 8:30pm and trying to get a drink proved almost impossible in the hotel. We had one evening where we went to one of the bars and despite seeing 6 people leave they refused to let us in, claiming they were full!
reviews.title: Excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very nice and English is widely spoken (if that's important to you) but I don't know if I'd stay here again as it was very staid and I felt as if I was 40 years to young to be there. It's also very expensive (although we got a very good deal through Expedia) and I think for the amount of money that you need to stay there I'd have been disappointed if we hadn't managed to get a discount.
reviews.title: Stiff, Overhyped, and Strange
Excellent but expensive
reviews.text: Overall it was good and a lovely end to our vacation. The location is second to none if you need to leave early but be prepared to feel like you need to whisper at all times and be in bed by 10pm.

Service, Accomodations, Public rooms, staff, convenience, VALUE. STYLE. This grand hotel had it all. A perfect oasis with easy access to everything via JR and metro within 3 mins. Taxi too. Breakfast bountiful (less good value, maybe) but setting and service outweighed. Great value for elegance, historically significant surroundings and very attentive, professional and solicitous staff. Comfortable.
reviews.title: Great hotel and staff and phenominal Tokyo location
